Description: Shoulder and neck sherd (mended from two fragments) of North Ionian(?) black-figured pottery krater or dinos; slight ridge at shoulder/neck join; interior of neck glazed, reserved below; exterior, cream slip; neck glazed; tongues at top of shoulder; below, goat facing left, originally black with red additions, much worn; rosette filling ornament beneath.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.1100)
